jobs_results.title: Software Engineering Manager, Android Developer Experience
jobs_results.description:
About the Role:

As a senior software engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and leading the implementation of large-scale infrastructure or distributed systems. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to architect and develop software or infrastructure for scalable, high-performance, distributed systems.

Responsibilities:
â€¢ Set and communicate team priorities that support the organization's goals.
â€¢ Align strategy, processes, and decision-making across teams.
â€¢ Meet regularly with individuals to discuss performance and development, provide feedback and coaching, and set clear expectations based on their level and role.
â€¢ Develop the mid-term technical vision and roadmap within the scope of your (often multiple) team(s).
â€¢ Evaluate evolving roadmaps to meet anticipated future requirements and infrastructure needs.
â€¢ Design, guide, and vet systems designs within the broader area, and write product or system development code to solve ambiguous problems.
â€¢ Review code developed by other engineers and provide feedback to ensure best practices.

About Google:

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another.

Requirements:
â€¢ Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
â€¢ 8 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages.
â€¢ 3 years of experience in a technical leadership role, overseeing strategic projects, with 2 years of experience in people management, supervision/team leadership.
â€¢ 3 years of experience building and developing large-scale infrastructure or distributed systems.
â€¢ Experience in Machine Learning or Artificial Intelligence.

Preferred Qualifications:
â€¢ Master's degree or PhD in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field.
â€¢ 3 years of experience working in a complex, matrixed organization.
â€¢ Experience architecting and developing software or infrastructure for scalable, high-performance, distributed systems.

Salary: $250,000 - $350,000 per year

jobs_results.title: Software Engineering Manager, Android Developer Experience | (FV-18)
jobs_results.description:
.
â€¢ *Minimum qualifications**:- Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.- 8 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages (e.G., Python, C, C++, Java, JavaScript).- 3 years of experience in a technical leadership role; overseeing strategic projects, with 2 years of experience in a people management, supervision/team leadership role.- 3 years of experience building and developing large-scale infrastructure or distributed systems.- Experience in Machine Learning or Artificial Intelligence.
â€¢ *Preferred qualifications**:- Master's degree or PhD in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field.- 3 years of experience working in a complex, matrixed organization.- Experience architecting and developing software or infrastructure for scalable, high performance, distributed systems.- Experience working with developer-focused products and tools.About the jobGoogle's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another.
Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search.
We are looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and isgrowing every day.
As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google's needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve.
We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.With your extensive technical expertise you take initiative to independently design and implement new systems, designing, implementing, and testing multiple features with little or no direction from tech lead or manager.
You collaborate with key stakeholders to determine future direction of work.Within Google, we have about 4,000 Android app developers across the company.
With a shift to a hybrid working environment for Google Android app developers, we need to re-architect and create new app developers tools that make working on Android seamless no matter if an Google app developer is in the office or working remotely.
This role is both managerial and technical.The Core team builds the technical foundation behind Google's flagship products.
We are owners and advocates for the underlying design elements, developer platforms, product components, and infrastructure at Google.
These are the essential building blocks for excellent, safe, and coherent experiences for our users and drive the pace of innovation for every developer

jobs_results.title: Lead Android Developer - Tech Holding
jobs_results.description:
About Us:

Tech Holding is a full-service consulting firm delivering predictable outcomes and high-quality solutions to clients. Our team members have industry experience, holding senior positions in various companies. We've developed a unique approach supported by deep expertise, integrity, transparency, and dependability.

The Role:

We're seeking an experienced Android developer to join our team. Responsibilities include:
â€¢ Building new features from the ground up or enhancing/maintaining existing projects.
â€¢ Architecting common packages and modules for use across different Android apps.
â€¢ Improving the mobile development stack for unit testing, CI/CD workflows, and deployment.
â€¢ Collaborating with onsite and overseas development teams.
â€¢ Working closely with product managers to turn product requirements into actionable technical stories.
â€¢ Discussing API and data requirements with backend engineers.
â€¢ Assisting QA teams by validating bugs and providing fixes.

Qualifications:

To be successful, you'll need:
â€¢ 4+ years of Android Development experience using Kotlin.
â€¢ Strong communication skills with different stakeholders.
â€¢ Experience with source control systems (Git).
â€¢ Consuming RESTful or GraphQL APIs.
â€¢ Push notification integration and deep linking.
â€¢ Latest development paradigms regarding performance, security, and coding best practices.
â€¢ Design patterns knowledge.
â€¢ Distributed remote team experience.

Estimated Salary: $120,000 - $180,000 per year.

jobs_results.title: Android Developer Experience Manager - Large Scale Infrastructure and Team Leadership
jobs_results.description:
â€¢ *About the Job:**

We are seeking an experienced Android Developer Experience Manager to join our Core team at Google. This role combines technical leadership with people management, requiring a unique blend of skills.
â€¢ *Key Responsibilities:**
â€¢ Set and communicate team priorities that support the organization's goals.
â€¢ Align strategy, processes, and decision-making across teams.

As a key member of our team, you will be responsible for designing, guiding, and vetting systems designs within the scope of the broader area, as well as writing product or system development code to solve ambiguous problems.

You will also review code developed by other engineers and provide feedback to ensure best practices. In addition, you will develop the mid-term technical vision and roadmap within the scope of your (often multiple) team(s).

This is a managerial and technical role that requires strong leadership qualities, enthusiasm to take on new problems, and versatility in working across the full-stack. You will have opportunities to switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves.
â€¢ *Requirements and Qualifications:**
â€¢ Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
â€¢ 8 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages (e.g., Python, C, C++, Java, JavaScript).
â€¢ 3 years of experience in a technical leadership role; overseeing strategic projects, with 2 years of experience in a people management, supervision/team leadership role.
â€¢ 3 years of experience building and developing large-scale infrastructure or distributed systems.
â€¢ Experience in Machine Learning or Artificial Intelligence.
â€¢ *Benefits:**
â€¢ A competitive salary ranging from $250,000 to $350,000 per year.
â€¢ Stock options and equity participation.
â€¢ A comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, and vision coverage.
â€¢ A generous retirement plan.
â€¢ *Additional Information:**

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
